name: Department of Education
description: The Department of Education promotes student achievement and preparation for global competitiveness by fostering educational excellence and ensuring equal access to educational opportunities.

painPoints.point: Student loan servicing system modernization required to handle increased volume and improve borrower experience, with legacy systems struggling with loan processing and repayment management
painPoints.source: Department of Education Strategic Plan & Budget Justification FY2025

painPoints.point: FAFSA system improvements needed to handle application volume, reduce processing delays, and enhance user experience for students and families applying for financial aid
painPoints.source: Department of Education IT Modernization Initiatives 2025

painPoints.point: Legacy IT infrastructure and systems across Department operations requiring modernization to improve efficiency, security, and user experience
painPoints.source: Department of Education IT Modernization Strategy

painPoints.point: Cybersecurity and student data protection challenges ensuring FERPA compliance while maintaining robust cybersecurity measures to protect sensitive student and financial aid data
painPoints.source: Department of Education Cybersecurity Strategy & OIG Reports

painPoints.point: Financial aid processing and grant management systems requiring modernization to improve accuracy, reduce processing time, and enhance oversight capabilities
painPoints.source: Department of Education Budget Justification FY2025

painPoints.point: Data analytics and reporting capabilities improvements needed to support evidence-based decision making, program evaluation, and performance monitoring
System integration and interoperability challenges across multiple disparate systems requiring better integration to enable data sharing and reduce redundancy
painPoints.source: Department of Education IT Modernization Initiatives

painPoints.point: IT acquisition and management challenges including project delays, budget overruns, and need for improved oversight and mature acquisition practices affecting student aid and education IT systems
painPoints.source: GAO High-Risk List 2025 - Improving IT Acquisitions and Management

primary: Department of Education Budget Justification FY2025 - https://www2.ed.gov/about/overview/budget/index.html
secondary: GAO Reports on Department of Education IT Management

evaluationFactors: Past performance with education or financial systems
FERPA compliance and data security capabilities

keyOffices: Office of the Chief Information Officer (OCIO)
Office of Planning, Evaluation and Policy Development (OPEPD)
insights: Student loan system modernization is a major focus - billions in loan portfolio requires modern systems
FAFSA system improvements are critical - affects millions of students annually
Strong need for FERPA-compliant cybersecurity solutions
Multiple legacy system replacement opportunities across department operations
Data analytics and reporting capabilities are growing priorities
Grant management systems (G5, Grants.gov) require ongoing improvements
Common Origination and Disbursement (COD) system needs modernization
